discoveredAssets: localhost:22222 - Web Terminal Application (xterm.js) - Port 22222, HTTP/1.1 with WebSocket support
localhost:2280 - HTTP Service (unknown purpose) - Port 2280, HTTP/1.1, returns 404 for all endpoints
localhost:22220 - Legacy HTTP/0.9 Service - Port 22220, HTTP/0.9 protocol
/xterm.js - Terminal Emulation Library (283KB minified) - Port 22222, JavaScript asset
/xterm-addon-fit.js - Terminal Fit Addon (1.5KB minified) - Port 22222, JavaScript addon library
/xterm.css - Terminal Styling Stylesheet (5.3KB) - Port 22222, CSS asset
WebSocket /ws endpoint - Bidirectional Terminal Communication - Port 22222, ws:// protocol, shell command execution interface

targets.objective: Test WebSocket authentication, authorization, and command injection vulnerabilities. Verify if authentication is required for shell access, test for privilege escalation, command injection attacks, and session validation.
targets.rationale: Critical remote code execution endpoint providing unauthenticated shell access via WebSocket. Direct shell command execution without apparent authentication mechanisms. Highest priority target.

targets.objective: Test for authentication bypass, session security flaws, XSS vulnerabilities in terminal output, CSRF attacks on terminal control, clickjacking, and client-side security issues.
targets.rationale: Web-based terminal interface accessible on internet-facing port. Provides human-accessible shell access if unauthenticated. Test for web vulnerabilities and authentication mechanisms.

targets.objective: Identify actual purpose and functionality. Test for hidden endpoints, API functionality, information disclosure, and potential backend services.
targets.rationale: Unknown HTTP service returning 404 for all tested endpoints. May have undiscovered functionality or hidden endpoints that require specific request patterns.

targets.objective: Determine service purpose and identify any exploitable vulnerabilities. Test protocol-specific issues and legacy service security.
targets.rationale: Legacy HTTP/0.9 protocol is non-standard. Potential security implications of running legacy protocols or unusual service configurations.

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] Unauthenticated WebSocket endpoint /ws on port 22222 provides direct shell command execution without visible authentication
[CRITICAL] Web Terminal application accessible from port 22222 enables remote shell access without apparent password or authentication
[HIGH] xterm.js library version and specific build information exposed through direct HTTP requests, may reveal known vulnerabilities
[HIGH] No authentication headers or login mechanism observed on Web Terminal interface
[MEDIUM] HTTP/0.9 legacy protocol running on port 22220 indicates unusual or legacy service configuration
[MEDIUM] Service on port 2280 returns 404 for all endpoints - purpose unclear, may have hidden functionality
[LOW] Standard xterm.js components properly exposed via HTTP (CSS, JavaScript libraries) - expected behavior
[MEDIUM] No visible security headers (X-Content-Type-Options present but missing HSTS, CSP, X-Frame-Options analysis needed) in HTTP responses
